intro: Schiedeella pandurata, commonly known as the pandurata sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its inflorescence consists of a single spikelet with three to five flowers, each with three stamens and a single pistil. Schiedeella pandurata is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in grasslands and along watercourses.
